feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Fiori
feed.subtitle: SAP Fiori Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Fiori Adaptation project Manage Purchase Order V2 to navigate directly to the create PO screen
entry.content:
Dear community, 

Within my company we do have the requirement to directly open the create purchase order screen from the Manage Purchase Order V2 app. However there's no semantic object and action available to do so.

 

I tried the next approach:

  • Create Adaptation project via BAS (Business Application Studio)
  • Create extension controller
  • Implement below code in the method onAfterRendering
sap.ui.define(
    [
        'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension'
        // ,'sap/ui/core/mvc/OverrideExecution'
    ],
    function (
        ControllerExtension
        // ,OverrideExecution
    ) {
        'use strict';
        return ControllerExtension.extend("customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton", {
            // metadata: {
            // 	// extension can declare the public methods
            // 	// in general methods that start with "_" are private
            // 	methods: {
            // 		publicMethod: {
            // 			public: true /*default*/ ,
            // 			final: false /*default*/ ,
            // 			overrideExecution: OverrideExecution.Instead /*default*/
            // 		},
            // 		finalPublicMethod: {
            // 			final: true
            // 		},
            // 		onMyHook: {
            // 			public: true /*default*/ ,
            // 			final: false /*default*/ ,
            // 			overrideExecution: OverrideExecution.After
            // 		},
            // 		couldBePrivate: {
            // 			public: false
            // 		}
            // 	}
            // },
            // // adding a private method, only accessible from this controller extension
            // _privateMethod: function() {},
            // // adding a public method, might be called from or overridden by other controller extensions as well
            // publicMethod: function() {},
            // // adding final public method, might be called from, but not overridden by other controller extensions as well
            // finalPublicMethod: function() {},
            // // adding a hook method, might be called by or overridden from other controller extensions
            // // override these method does not replace the implementation, but executes after the original method
            // onMyHook: function() {},
            // // method public per default, but made private via metadata
            // couldBePrivate: function() {},
            // // this section allows to extend lifecycle hooks or override public methods of the base controller
            override: {
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Called when a controller is instantiated and its View controls (if available) are already created.
                // 	 * Can be used to modify the View before it is displayed, to bind event handlers and do other one-time initialization.
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                onInit: function () {
                    console.log("Adaption Bart is triggered.");

                },
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Similar to onAfterRendering, but this hook is invoked before the controller's View is re-rendered
                // 	 * (NOT before the first rendering! onInit() is used for that one!).
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                // 	onBeforeRendering: function() {
                // 	},
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Called when the View has been rendered (so its HTML is part of the document). Post-rendering manipulations of the HTML could be done here.
                // 	 * This hook is the same one that SAPUI5 controls get after being rendered.
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                onAfterRendering: function () {

                    var oButton = sap.ui.getCore().byId("ui.ssuite.s2p.mm.pur.po.manage.st.s1::sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ListReport.view.ListReport::C_PurchaseOrderTP--addEntry");
                    if (oButton && typeof oButton.firePress === "function") {
                        oButton.firePress();
                    }  
     
                },
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Called when the Controller is destroyed. Use this one to free resources and finalize activities.
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                // 	onExit: function() {
                // 	},
                // 	// override public method of the base controller
                // 	basePublicMethod: function() {
                // 	}
            }
        });
    }
);

The strange thing is that it's working with "Preview Application" in BAS.

But when deployed to the the S4 on-Premise (2023 FPS01) it's not working and throwing an error in the console.

Any thoughts?

Thanks in advance.

Best Regards, Bart

entry.title: ZUI_C_TRAVEL_M_XXX(1) service not available while following the tutorial to create Fiori app
entry.content:
I created a List report Fiori app following the below the tutorial:

Create a SAP Fiori App and Deploy it to SAP BTP, ABAP Environment | SAP Tutorials

I am stuck at Step 4 since I cant find "ZUI_C_TRAVEL_M_XXX(1) - OData V2". Is there an another tutorial that covers the creation of this service as a prerequisite ?

entry.title: Clicking the Backpage button in the Fiori app causes an HTTP 400 and HTTP 0 error
entry.content:
Hello, senior
I don't know much about FIORI, so I'd like to ask for your opinion.
The customer has contacted us that an error occurs when the return page button is pressed from the FIORI web.
It's my first time seeing this error, but could you tell me if you've experienced the same error or how to solve it?
 
※Error message
A back-end error has caused the application to terminate.
Error message returned:
HTTP 400 or HTTP 0

entry.title: Code of S4hana public cloud Standart Fiori Apps to BTP
entry.content:
HI all, on Public cloud is there any way to download the code of Standart Fiori app?

From time to time we have requirements to create side-by-side developments that re-create some apps from Cloud on BTP with more functionalities. Sometimes easy way would be clone the app on BTP, and after perform necessary changes.

What is the easy way to do that on S4/hana Public cloud?

entry.title: Extend C_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt with custom fields in Fiori app Manage Purchase Requisitions (F2229)
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We want to extend Account Assignment table in Purchase Requisition Item with a few custom fields (columns) that are added using Append Structure in table EBKN. From our understanding, we need to extend the CDS view C_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt. 

This CDS view seems to have a chain of CDS selection before finally getting the data from table EBKN, i.e. C_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt -> T_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt -> I_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt -> I_PurReqnAcctAssgmt -> I_PurReqnAcctAssgmtBasic -> EBKN.

After checking some documentation, we found another CDS view E_Purreqnacctassgmt, which we thought could be used, but extending it doesn't help us in accessing those custom fields in C_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt or directly in the Fiori app.

Could someone suggest which CDS views we should extend to get these columns (custom fields) in the Fiori app, or is there a better way?

We tried checking first in Custom Fields and Logic app for a relevant Business Context for PR Account Assignment, but couldn't find anything appropriate. We still would like to keep our development as clean-core as possible.

entry.title: Step-by-Step Guide to Enabling the HTML5 Applications Repository in SAP BTP
entry.content:
This Blog explain the how to enable the HTML5 Applications repository

At first we need to enable the 2 things successfully like 

1. Cloud Identity Services

2. SAP Build Work Zone

In the very first step is to click the Create option in your Instances and Subscriptions tab

In this New Instance Window click on Cloud Identity Services then Plan will be default

Service: Cloud Identity Services

Plan: default

Once you done click on Create in the Bottom of the Screen

Once you have create the above service successfully then we need to move on to the Users tab then click on user we need and click on Assign Role Collection

Once you click on that the Assign Role Collection Dialogue will open then we need to search and assign the roles in below

Cloud Connector Administrator, Connectivity and Destination Administrator, Subaccount Service Administrator, Subaccount Viewer

Once you have assigned the role it will looks like below

After completing the above step, please check your email for a message regarding identity authentication. Click the link provided in the email to activate it and verify your account.

 

 

Once you click on the link the Cloud Identity service will open if not just go the Cloud Identity service which was in your BTP Instance and service

 

 

Once you have verified through mail move to the Instances and Subscriptions tab click on Cloud Identity then click Go to Application

 

Once you have done you will see this page Cloud Identity Services in this click on User Management

After clicking the User Management verify the user credentials here

Then move on the Trust Configuration Part under the Security then click on Establish Trust the configure Tenant pop up will open

In this select the Default value 

In this choose Domain option choose option end with ‘trail-accound.ondemand.com’

Then click on create to sap build work zone

With this you can go for standard subscription plan

We have successfully activated the sap Build work zone

 

Then will check on HTML5 Applications tab you can see HTML5 application now allow to add application here, Thank for Reading!

entry.title: Flexible Programming Model sortOrder ignored by macros Table
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have a FPM project with first view containing macros Filterbar und Table.

The table displays the data, but ignores the CDS Annotation SortOrder from the PresentationVarian:

.presentationVariant: [{
qualifier: 'DefaultSorter',
sortOrder: [{ by: 'ManufacturingOrder', direction: #DESC }],
visualizations: [{type: #AS_LINEITEM }]
}]

I even added the property to the manifest file:

"defaultTemplateAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.PresentationVariant#DefaultSorter",

I can see in the oData metadata the annotation is present.

I am currently using the 1.120.0 version, but the same result is with 1.141.3

Is there any additional property expected by the macros table? In the API Dokumentation it is written :
Usually, a LineItem, PresentationVariant, or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation is expected, but the Table building block can also be used to display an EntitySet.
If a PresentationVariant is specified, then it must have UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.

 

Thanks for you help!

@Navin_Krishnan

entry.title: Check the Purchasing document status managed by Flexible Workflow as a creator
entry.content:

entry.title: Partner function not visible in Manage Purchase contract app
entry.content:
Hello,

In the Manage Purchase Contract app when the supplier and other header details are entered the Partner function is not loaded. I am not sure what is wrong, I have checked all the SAP relevant notes but the section is blank. We had a minor upgrade but nothing related to the supplier logic was touched. 

I also ran the F12 browser debug and found no error there. There was no authorisation error in SU53 or dumps in ST22. All the services are running as expected

entry.title: Adaptation project in Fiori HANA: override (onInit, onCustom, etc ) not being called/ not working
entry.content:
I have extended a Fiori HANA App in BAS with an adaptation project and I want to override the methods. 

sap.ui.define(
    [
        'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension'
        //,'sap/ui/core/mvc/OverrideExecution'
    ],
    function (
        ControllerExtension
        //,OverrideExecution
    ) {
        'use strict';
        return ControllerExtension.extend("customer.mytimeeventsextension.CustomListReportController", {        
            override: {                
                onExit: function(){
                    debugger;
                },
                test:function(){
                    
                }
            },
            
        });
    }
);

 

{
  "changeType": "codeExt",
  "reference": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "namespace": "apps/customer.mytimeeventsextension/changes/",
  "creation": "2025-10-31T10:45:14.615Z",
  "projectId": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "moduleName": "customer/mytimeeventsextension/changes/coding/CustomListReportController",

entry.title: sap fiori List Report with Filterbar multi input custom filter
entry.content:
Is there any way to implement preload with variant management on Filterbar (oData v4) custom filter fields Multi Input filter? im currently facing this issue, we have a page with custom filter fields, but im not able to retrieve the value, just using Value implementation mentioned here:

https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/468a97775123488ab3345a0c48cadd8f/5fb9f57fcf12401bbe39a635e9a32a4e.html

we have samples for: Range (primitive), Value (primitive), Multi Input (token) * we do not have native preload

i need a example for sap.fe.macros.filter.type.MultiValue to use with sap.m.MultiInput with value help (to load variant value by native)

i tried to implement preload but fiori keeps preventing this by keeping dirty states, so im opening this topic to see is there any cleaner way to do that

entry.title: beforeOpenContextMenu is not firing when right-clicking on a group header in sap.ui.table.Analytical
entry.content:
Hi,

I am using an SAPUI5 Analytical Table where grouping is implemented at one level.
When I right-click on a group header, the context menu opens with options such as Ungroup Level and Ungroup All.
Since I am using only one grouping level, I would like to hide one of these options (for example, Ungroup Level).
To achieve this, I tried using the beforeOpenContextMenu event to modify the menu items dynamically. However, this event does not trigger when right-clicking on the group header.
On the other hand, the attachColumnSelect event is triggered correctly when right-clicking on a column header (for sorting and filtering), and I am able to hide unwanted menu items there.
I expect similar behavior when right-clicking on the group header to customize that context menu as well.

Steps to Reproduce:
Use an Analytical Table (sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable) with one-level grouping enabled.
Right-click on a column header → attachColumnSelect triggers correctly.
Right-click on a group header (e.g., “Company Code = XXXX”) → context menu appears with Ungroup Level and Ungroup All options.
Observe that the beforeOpenContextMenu event does not trigger.

Expected Behavior:
When the user right-clicks on a group header, the beforeOpenContextMenu event should trigger so that developers can modify or hide specific menu options (for example, remove Ungroup Level when only one grouping level is used).

Actual Behavior:
The context menu is displayed when right-clicking on a group header, but the beforeOpenContextMenu event is not fired.

Code Snippet Used:
const oTable = this.byId("dynamicTable");
// Works on column header right-click
oTable.attachColumnSelect((oEvent) => {
    console.log(oEvent);
});

// Not triggered on group header right-click
oTable.attachBeforeOpenContextMenu((oEvent) => {
    console.log("Context menu event triggered:", oEvent);
});

Please let me know if I am missing anything or if there is an alternative way to capture the context menu event on group headers to modify or remove menu options dynamically.

Regards,
Sridevi

entry.title: CAP backend service through BTP configured Destination
entry.content:
Dear all,

We are writing to request assistance with a configuration issue on our SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment. We are encountering a consistent 500 Internal Server Error when our SAPUI5 application attempts to call a CAP backend service through a configured Destination.

System Architecture:

  • Frontend: A SAPUI5 application (UI5 version 1.140.0) deployed on SAP BTP.

  • Backend: An SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) application deployed as a back-end service on the same BTP CF space.

  • Connectivity: The frontend connects to the backend via a BTP Destination named EINV_CAP_BackEnd_SRV.

  • Authentication: The connection is secured using OAuth2ClientCredentials flow with an XSUAA service instance as shown below:

 

 

Problem Description:
When the frontend application makes a call to the OData service endpoint (/odata/v4/catalg/), the request fails with a 500 Internal Server Error.

 



 

Troubleshooting Steps and Findings:
We have performed several tests to isolate the issue, and here is what we have confirmed:

  1. The CAP Backend Service is Working: If we call the CAP service endpoint directly using Postman and provide a manually obtained Bearer Token, we receive a 200 OK response with the expected data. This confirms that the service logic is correct.

  2. The BTP Destination is Working: We have successfully tested the EINV_CAP_BackEnd_SRV destination using the BTP Cockpit's "Check Connection" feature and also by calling the Destination Service API via Postman. In both cases, the destination successfully fetches a valid JWT Bearer Token from the XSUAA service. Here below the evidences:

     




  1. Authentication Flow Seems Partially Correct: We are not receiving 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden errors.

Based on these findings, we believe the issue lies in the interaction between the Approuter, the Destination Service, and the CAP service's security validation.

Configuration Details:

  • Destination: EINV_CAP_BackEnd_SRV

    • Type: HTTP

    • URL: https://d03-e-invoice01-cf01-d03-e-invoice01-cf01-sp01-fatturaz2a9200d4.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/

    • Proxy Type: Internet

    • Authentication: OAuth2ClientCredentials

    • Client ID: sb-FatturazioneElettronicaAttiva!t566124

    • Token Service URL: https://d03-e-invoice01.authentication.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

  • xs-app.json Route Configuration:

codeJSON

{

"source": "^/odata/v4/catalg/(.*)$",

"target": "/odata/v4/catalg/$1",

"destination": "EINV_CAP_BackEnd_SRV",

"authenticationType": "xsuaa",

"csrfProtection": false

}

 



  • manifest.json DataSource Configuration:

codeJSON

"dataSources": {

"capSrv": {

"uri": "/odata/v4/catalg/",

"type": "OData",

"settings": {

"odataVersion": "4.0"

}

}

}

 



Could someone please assist us in identifying the cause of this 500 error? Any guidance on how to further debug this or what might be misconfigured would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your time

entry.title: My Inbox Approve / Reject buttons are not Triggering in backend through Custom Workflow.
entry.content:
Hi all,

My Inbox Approve / reject are not triggering in backend. After Clicking Approve Button , And Giving Task Processed succefully pop-up is coming but it not triggering in sap backend for HCM Module. 

Do we need to implement any BAdi or BAPIs please provide. or any SAP Note or any links will be helpful.

Thank you.
